body:
I don't know if this is the right place for this discussion. Please redirect me to more proper place.

I've been looking for a way to secure my API and reached this page. From what I can see on SO and on every blog post about creating Rails API, no one is mentioning how to protect your API from forgery, just how to disable protection, because then you can access the API. I think this is a big security issue.
There should definitely be some method treat_as_api or the like, because it's unclear how to make your API secure.

For the moment, I solved it like this:
class Api::V1::BaseApiController < ApplicationController
  protect_from_forgery with: :null_session
end

Is this a good approach?
